content.prompt: Insertion sort works similarly to how one would sort a hand of cards: by choosing an element and searching through the rest of the array to determine its proper place. Construct a function that performs insertion sort in ascending order on the given list.
content.source_code:
# Define the insertion sorting function that sorts the given list in an ascending order
def insertion_sort(data):
    for i in range(1, len(data)):
        current = data[i]
        j = i-1
        while j>=0 and current < data[j]:
            data[j+1] = data[j]
            j -=1
        data[j+1] = current
    return data
num_list = [30, -20, 25, 0, 2, 5]
print(insertion_sort(num_list))
